learning.title: Eliciting Insights via Interviews and Surveys

questions.promptMd: Which survey/interview practice reduces bias most effectively?

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Neutral, single‑topic questions reduce bias.

answers.contentMd: Recruit only enthusiasts for faster responses
Ask for preferences instead of observing behavior
answers.feedbackMd: Behavioral data is stronger than stated preferences.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Triangulating interviews with analytics and support tickets improves insight quality.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Multiple data sources strengthen confidence.

questions.promptMd: What is the best debrief artifact after interviews?

answers.contentMd: Affinity‑clustered themes with quotes and implications
answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Themes → insights → implications support messaging decisions.
Hard to act on without synthesis.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Small, biased samples are acceptable if findings feel intuitively right.

answers.feedbackMd: Biased samples risk misleading decisions—expand or triangulate.
Correct. Validate with better sampling or multiple sources.
